metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9078 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
The server in Dropbear before 2017.75 might allow post-authentication rootremote code execution because of a double free in cleanup of TCP listenerswhen the -a option is enabled.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9078` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

dropbear - 2017.74-3build1
dropbear-bin - 2017.74-3build1
dropbear-initramfs - 2017.74-3build1
dropbear-run - 2017.74-3build1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: dropbear package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2017.74-3build1').
